bibl.title: Letter from A.S. Hardy to Emilie Lawrence Reed, July 25, 1927

div1.p: Hardy requests information on Walter Reed. He wants to make Reed's birthplace a national shrine.

div1.head: Letter from A.S. Hardy to Emilie Lawrence Reed, July 25, 1927
div1.opener:
431- Socust St
Johnson City ???
July 25th 1927
Mrs Walter Reed
Blue Ridge Summit Penn
Dear Madam
div1.p:
In a late Newspaper item
of a few lines - it was stated that “The State
of Virginia was about to take action in the
purchase of the old home of Dr Walter Reed in
Gloucester County in Virginia to be kept as a
Shrine in his honor,

I was born in Middlesex County Va March 25th
1844 - served through the Civil war in Lee's Army-am
still a rebel patriot - ready to give honor to whom
honor is due, I undoubtedly believe that
Dr Reed's discovery as to yellow fever made of
him the outstanding man of science of any age
Conferring the greatest boon on the human race
it has reined in all time from an earthly standpoint,
and yet one find among people generally a most
lamentable ignorance of what Dr Reed accomplished.

In talking with Judge Cox of this town-
a lawyer and a gentleman of talent and influence
in Tenn and neighboring States he expressed
warm admiration for Dr Reed and said that if
you would give in a letter a sketch of Dr Reed-
the salient points in his discovery of this great
benefaction - and any other information you
may see fit to give bearing on this matter
the character of which to be left entirely to
your judgement - and your wishes to be respected
that he would gladly do all in his power in
giving lectures before Rotary Clubs and in
Newspaper Articles &c, as the best way of
bringing this matter to the attention of people

Any information bearing on the matter
in hand - The character of which is entirely
at your discretion will be useful to us
and your wishes shall be duly respected

We have no other source from which to
gain information- One thing or would like
to know is- What has the Gov- done as to any
expenditure Dr Reed may have made in his
discovery - in rewarding him or his family &c

Now wed like to know the answer to these
questions- but you can answer them or not
just as you see fit

We think this the best way to render
even belated honor to the memory of Dr Reed-
his family and his State-

closer.salute: I am Madame with great respect
